canonical_structure.name: UBX-RXM-MEASC12
canonical_structure.description: Satellite measurements for CloudLocate location service (second 12 bytes message)

issues: Failed to identify the repeating group structure
The length formula 'N' is too generic and omits the 12-byte multiplier typical for this message class
Misses the relationship between the message name (C12) and the data structure

adjudication.reasoning: UBX-RXM-MEASC12 (and its counterparts MEASC1, MEASC2, MEASC22) are specifically designed to provide blocks of satellite measurement data for u-blox's CloudLocate service. Each 'measurement' for a satellite is encapsulated in a 12-byte block. Extraction 2 correctly captures this repeating structure (N * 12 bytes). Extraction 1 treats the entire payload as an opaque blob (U1[N]), which, while technically representing the same bytes, fails to describe the protocol's structural logic or the meaning of the data blocks. In u-blox interface manuals, even when the data is proprietary, the length is explicitly defined as a multiple of the satellite count (numMeas).
